metadata.synopsis: Gazzet wanderer greeting AD.The wanderer roams around Blushing Mermaid
metadata.how_to_trigger: - CTY_Main_A- Initial position of the wanderer -134; 15; -117

1.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
1.text: It seems no commemorative events for Lord Gortash are planned at the Mermaid.
1.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

7.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
7.text: This tavern is content to be a blight not only on the eyes, but also the soul.

2.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
2.text: One would think, dear readers, that the death of Lord Gortash would inspire solemnity.
2.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

16.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
16.text: This is most untrue of the Blushing Mermaid. A raucous hive, as usual.
16.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

3.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
3.text: Not content with broadsheet front pages, criminals stalk outside the Mermaid.
3.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

8.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
8.text: I'm sorry to report, faithful readers, that the Mermaid's staff do not care...

6.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
6.text: Look, what are heroic folks like you doing near a dump like the Mermaid?
6.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

20.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
20.text: Can hardly lambast the place if you're here. My readers will revolt.

9.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
9.text: While taverns like the Elfsong sit in safe streets - this is not true of the Mermaid.
9.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

0.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
0.text: Vagabonds and criminals frequent the Mermaid's exterior, dear readers.

11.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
11.text: The Mermaid, faithful readers, has the tackiest architecture...
11.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

10.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
10.text: ...matched only in disappointment by its threadbare pint selection.
10.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

12.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
12.text: New, heroic clientele may be visiting the Blushing Mermaid, dear readers.
12.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

13.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
13.text: Readers sad at recent news may think the Mermaid a tempting sorrow-drowning spot.
13.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

4.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
4.text: But there are better drinking spots to commemorate the late Lord Gortash.
4.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

14.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
14.text: While I would love to report the Mermaid as nothing but an absolute hive...
14.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

19.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
19.text: ...it appears local heroes frequent the tavern. Why? Only the gods can know.

18.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
18.text: Tavern Review enthusiasts will note the absence of the landlord from this article.
18.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

5.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
5.text: While I requested an interview, Captain Grisly certainly lives up to her name.

21.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
21.text: The Blushing Mermaid. Not my preferred drinking hole, dear readers.
21.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

15.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
15.text: In fact, 'hole' may the perfect word to describe the tavern...
15.context: NodeContext: composing a future newspaper article (almost like they're dictating) out lourd

22.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
22.text: Expect unceasing harassment by scum outside the Blushing Mermaid.

17.speaker: Wrint Sprigley
17.text: Would anyone feel safe in a place like this? Not I, dear readers. Not I.
